item.title: Castletownloyal add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Castletownloyal add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "By Aladdin's lamplit scrotum, man! Everything is a story. What is there but stories? Stories are the only truth." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Castletownloyal add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Morality is everywhere the same for all men, therefore it comes from God; sects differ, therefore they are the work of men." -- Voltaire

item.title: Castletownloyal add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Castletownloyal add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Watching a dog try to chew a large piece of toffee is a pastime fit for gods. Mr. Fusspot's mixed ancestry had given him a dexterity of jaw that was truly awesome. He somersaulted happily around the floor, making faces like a rubber gargoyle in a washing machine." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Castletownloyal add a quote by Pope John XXIII
item.description: "The mark of Cain is stamped upon our foreheads. Across the centuries, our brother Abel was lain in blood which we drew, and shed tears we caused by forgetting Thy love. Forgive us, Lord, for the curse we falsely attributed to their name as Jews. Forgive us for crucifying Thee a second time in their flesh. For we knew not what we did." -- Pope John XXIII

item.title: Castletownloyal add a quote by Mary Todd Lincoln
item.description: "Beautiful, Glorious Scotland, has spoilt me for every other country." -- Mary Todd Lincoln
